intro: Iris bastardii, commonly known as the bastard iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves and a tall flowering stem. Its flowers consist of three upright petals and three downward-curving sepals, forming a distinctive shape. Iris bastardii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
